column5: Sure hope you can get through the rags. We'll be going through there on June 7. WHere do you park your houseboat? We are going up top to Merritt past Chamberlain Narrows this year.

Hi All. We are heading to Fisherman's Cove on Lac Seul June 1-8 and are curious if anyone knows when the ice went out and how the water temps are or if the spawn has started. We are really looking forward to a spring trip. It has been a long time since going in June....have had several fall trips lately so looking forward to getting back to try early season. Thanks!
I'm leaving Friday, I can let you know how things are when I'm there. Hopefully a local will chime in on this thread now!

Most everywhere is ice free.was still ice on saturday on some lakes,might be a few ice cubes floating.I fished cliff lake and it's all gone and was reading 42 f water temp.usually they will be spawning in the sanctuaries and other places,bays and some shorelines where water temps are warmer.usually the east shorelines on lac suel is where warmer water comes from other sources.thats where the best fishing will if you want to the trip.slower fishing near fisherman's cove as the water temps on that side are always colder.most guys seem to fish the far end of Mackenzie bay or head into broad and sunlight lakes.
Thanks for the updates. Looking forward to our trip in a few weeks. Good luck Knoxabilly when you head up this week.
We will be there (LS) June 6th - 12th, should be pretty good. LM
Hey Prov, How does the water level on LS look at the moment? I was there October 1st and it looked to be down 2-3 feet. Thanks, LM
Talked to Blair from onaway and he said it's up
LM: Looks like it IS headed the right direction: As in UP...........https://lwcb.ca/pdf/LacSeulGraph2019.05.16.pdf

Yes, Looking at the site as compared to last year it looks like the water level is about 12 - 18 inches higher, enough that we'll probably go through the Rags next Tuesday on our way to Chamberlain Narrows.
